column4: the alternate install dvd has a default option to use the internet to download packages whether you click yes or no when the upgrade option box pops up after installing the dvd
if you have an internet connection it will use it whether you tell it to or not
even if you think you are selecting the option to tell it not to
this is kind of like false advertising if I cannot upgrade using the CD files instead of the net
I have 2 ubuntu 9.04 dvds and ironically with both of them I cannot upgrade my OS to 9.04
not from my computer anyway
it is forcing me to use a net connection
I don't know why I have to wait 2 more days to upgrade my OS on dialup when I have the ___________ dvd's right here in front of me
frustrating
that is not logical to design an upgrade this way
Sorry man I don't think you can really get by with dialup and this OS
you can but it will take a looooooooooooooong time
and if not well I guess it is good enough reason to switch to primarily using a mac
or another distro of Linux
nope a mac
yuck
I'm going to be burnt out after Ubuntu
if the best distro on the net can't give me what I need ...
I doubt another will
ok
best is subjective
